metadata.Title: CVE-2018-10932 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description: lldptool version 1.0.1 and older can print a raw, unsanitized attacker controlled buffer when mngAddr information is displayed. This may allow an attacker to inject shell control characters into the buffer and impact the behavior of the terminal.

criterions.comment: lldpad: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
